WorkItem.Description:
I've spent about 5k plus gold on re-socketing gems over and over again the last month.  Sources tell me that hit cap and expertise cap are vital for dps yet RAWR tells me to stack strength gems.   Should I ignore going after these hit and expertise caps?   I mananged to acquire both caps but at the expense of losing several strength gems and have seen about a 500 dps loss.   I am at a loss for dps as a warrior.   What gems get priority as a warrior dps strength, hit, or expertise?   In addition does RAWR account hit and expertise rating into its dps model?
 
My character name is Louferrigno and is on the Deathwing server.
 
One last question I have atm is whether or not i should roll fury once I get another edge of ruin form Htoc?

Comments.Message: Are you looking at the items themselves in the comparison charts or is it telling you this on an Optimize with all the Hit/Exp gems active? Please post your character file

http://www.wowarmory.com/character-sheet.xml?r=Deathwing&n=Louferrigno

This is my link to the armory.   Hope this is what you mean by post.  ATM I'm still learning rawr so if there's anything else I can do to help me understand this please let me know.  Thank You and I really appreciate your time.

Armory was a good start, that does help, yes.

For future reference: posting your character file means taking the "Character.xml" file that you are saving on YOUR system and using the Attach File box just below this

If you're arms, the current information out there is that Expertise is not your strongest stat pre-cap, due to Overpower.  This doesn't make Expertise BAD, it just means that if you have the choice, you'll get more out of a 20str gem then you would a 20exp gem.

Hit cap, on the other hand, is pretty much required; if you ever see Rawr suggesting strength over hit gems, post your character file, because either you're doing something wrong or you found a bug.
---
One big thing to check is that you have hit and expertise gems marked as available.  On the right side of the main screen of Rawr, click the "Gear" dropdown box and make it say "Gems".  Then, click on the gems you want to consider using -- you should see a green diamond.  Then optimize, and see if you get better results.
